post.body: Glad you bought Mikkels book, I'm waiting for my copy. It was great to have been apart of that project. http://tinyurl.com/5zkevf
turns out Las Vegas might be recession proof. Or people are just flocking here to get away from stinky old reality for a while.
agreed. and good riddance.
hey, what ever works right? I still miss the monitor I used with my old Commodore 64.
Awesome pano John, it looks great. Which camera/lens did you use?
"Photogrizzle"
I think I'm going to go with a real tree - from a Xmas tree farm. After Christmas i'll return it to them for composting. â˜®
I'm going to stick with the D3 for now. She's waay more than I need. Plus I'm still getting accustomed to it.
thanks for mentioning me in your blog post. And very nice article on "Photographers on Twitter" - http://tinyurl.com/6gfous
Hey Wade, yup I'll be there. Looking forward to catching up.
Unfortunately it has to run in an "approved" newspaper. Read "old government".
that's one helluva drive for a party man. http://tinyurl.com/5o53hp
I do follow you, how else could you direct message me.
The Wordpress upgrade went very smoothly. Love the new UI.
last minute Xmas shopping is kind of a ritual with me. It's actually kind of fun... as long as you have a good naughty-nice list.
still love the Canon G9, it and my Nikon D700 are my most used gear.
pfft. you humans are all the same.
no thank you. ;0)
posted a picture of me to Flickr... I look like a drug-crazed Klingon. http://tinyurl.com/84wkxx
now THAT would be pretty difficult.
yep... the next video I post on FrederickVan.com will use this 3-second animation as a header.
I don't think it's a mistake. I think it's because the G9 has time-lapse, higher rez video, etc. http://tinyurl.com/939ktq
now choosing like that would be very narrow-minded of me, wouldn't it? Kind of like spitting in the wind to curse it.
I used the G9 and Premiere Pro CS4 for the Michael Adams video. http://tinyurl.com/79eff4
yep, I've not been disappointed with the G9. In fact my buddy @alexlindsay tells me the G9 now sells for more than the G10!
is it about loyalty? Or the best tool for the job. If I were employed by either company, then loyalties would enter into it.
I used a Canon G9 to shoot that video. I just wish it had an audio-in jack.
wondering if it's more "green" to buy a real Christmas tree, or get a fake one. Thoughts?
Here's a good "first-impressions", and unapologetic article on the Nikon D3x. http://tinyurl.com/6eebqw
Wedding shooter Marcus Bell just revamped his blog, with a review and sample pics from the new Nikon D3x! http://tinyurl.com/6cbwvb
http://twitpic.com/ovwe - Birthday dinner, teppan yaki style!
Thank you everyone for all of the birthday wishes! It's been an amazing birthday WEEK!
FYI, Lightroom 2 is 50% off (thats half) through Amazon.com from Black Friday thru midnight Sunday... Gobble-gobble!
Just introduced Dad to Google Street View on his iPhone. Exploring the old neighborhood. He's shocked and awed.
Organizing my Dads severely disorganized Lightroom library.
Getting ready to board a flight from San Jose to Las Vegas. Strangely, the airport isn't all that crowded.
Ordering a few Moo Mosaic frames as gifts... http://tinyurl.com/579k4e
my web hosting provider (siteground.com) is whack. Any suggestions on who to move to? I just need server space and email.
RT @mikema: Oh SNAP! DPReview just laid the smack down on the G10. LX3 would have been nice, but not enough tele http://is.gd/8Zr3
wondering how I ended up with such a good group of friends.
Photographing Treasure Island. Amazing place! http://piurl.com/oCi : current location
Getting ready to head over to Treasure Island for the Photojojo photo safari. Awesome weather! http://piurl.com/oBR : current location
Just won a bet using Google (with voice recognition) to verify. Is that geeky?
just about to record an episode of TWiP with @alexlindsay, @stevesimon, and @halfpress - I'm BAACK!
Relieving stress playing Gears of War 2.
Relaxing and getting a haircut in San Jose. Barber uses clippers and an old fashioned straight razor. http://piurl.com/s6G : current locati
business license - check. Next up, checking account.
just ordered a loaded 15" MacbookPro. The heart of any good business.
Merlin Mann @43folders has written great post entitled "Photography, and the Tolerance for Courageous Sucking". http://tinyurl.com/55o7xu
at the San Jose Mercury News trying to run the requisite ficticious business name classified ad. The front line people don't know how. Sad.
Hanging out with the Peachpit Press crew, at Peachpit HQ. http://piurl.com/txG : current location
multitasking, watching "The Dark Knight", while working on my website. Expect Joker influences in the final design... "why so serious?" LOL
reviewing a draft of a wedding photo contract... thanks @sarafrance for the insight! You caught things my lawyer missed.
At Adobe HQ having lunch with my Lightroom peeps. http://piurl.com/uaN : current location
Livebooks.com has a great series of short interviews with some prominent professional photographers. http://tinyurl.com/6rjquj
just added Google Friend Connect to my blog... looks like an interesting (easy) way to add social networking hooks http://tinyurl.com/6hogds
Celebrating the holiday season at Matrix on Filmore in SF. http://piurl.com/vTK : current location
upgrading to Wordpress 2.7. Hope I don't bring my blog down.
Our guest on TWiP this week is iStock shooter @nicolesy !
recording TWiP with @alexlindsay, @stevesimon, @ronbrinkmann, @scottbourne, and @halfpress... awesome show!
thinking finishing up Christmas shopping today might be a good idea.
animating my FrederickVan logo in After Effects CS4.
sitting in Starbucks about to edit a video interview of @nicolesy. Hmm, Premiere Pro CS4, or Final Cut Pro 6? Both are installed.
still trying to get used to the new button-less (all a button) MacBook Pro trackpad. Damn these cursed fingers!
New blog post: Michael Adams - Son of Ansel Adams http://tinyurl.com/79eff4
recording a "holiday gift ideas" episode on This Week in Photography (TWiP) with @alexlindsay, @halfpress, @stevesimon, and @ronbrinkmann
another great article on how to make Twitter (more) useful from @guykawasaki http://tinyurl.com/6fxmj9
